channel.title: Opening a Box Problem

item.title: Opening a Box Problem
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

[quote=“Chassy13, post:3, topic:271391”][quote author=The Soul link=topic=358134.msg2734885#msg2734885 date=1238990963]
You’d need to create an array in the Item3 class that holds the item IDs of your choice, like so.

public static int mysterybox[] = {####, ####, ####};

Then what you’re going to do is call the array from the Item3 class and implement the misc.random, as shown below.

c.addItem(Item3.mysterybox[misc.random((int) Item3.mysterybox.length)]);

[/quote]

It doensn’t have to be item3 class. Your other decent option is to declare it in your client class.[/quote]

I was merely giving an example, but you’re right.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening a Box Problem
item.dc:creator: @Elven_Dremor Elven Dremor
item.description:
@Elven_Dremor wrote:

I don’t have Item3, and I just want it to have a random chance of giving a few Item IDs.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening a Box Problem
item.dc:creator: @chassy13 Chassy13
item.description:
@chassy13 wrote:

[quote=“The Soul, post:2, topic:271391”]You’d need to create an array in the Item3 class that holds the item IDs of your choice, like so.

public static int mysterybox[] = {####, ####, ####};

Then what you’re going to do is call the array from the Item3 class and implement the misc.random, as shown below.

c.addItem(Item3.mysterybox[misc.random((int) Item3.mysterybox.length)]);

It doensn’t have to be item3 class. Your other decent option is to declare it in your client class.

Read full topic

item.title: Opening a Box Problem
item.dc:creator: @the_soul The Soul
item.description:
@the_soul wrote:

You’d need to create an array in a class, could be any class, that holds the item IDs of your choice, like so.

public static int mysterybox[] = {####, ####, ####};

Then what you’re going to do is call the array and implement the misc.random, as shown below.

c.addItem(mysterybox[misc.random mysterybox.length)]);

Read full topic

item.title: Opening a Box Problem
item.dc:creator: @Elven_Dremor Elven Dremor
item.description:
@Elven_Dremor wrote:

Hi, I want my Mystery Box, ID is 6199. To randomly give you like whip,dfs,fury etc… Like when they have the box and they open it they randomly get an Item. This is what I got Please help me fix.

case 6199: c.deleteItem(6199, c.getItemSlot(6199), 1); c.addItem(misc.random, 1); break;

Read full topic
